documentation.text:
@dev `Owned` is a base level contract that assigns an `owner` that can be
  later changed

@dev `owner` is the only address that can call a function with this
 modifier
@notice The Constructor assigns the message sender to be `owner`

@dev `Escapable` is a base level contract built off of the `Owned`
  contract that creates an escape hatch function to send its ether to
  `escapeHatchDestination` when called by the `escapeHatchCaller` in the case that
  something unexpected happens

@dev The addresses preassigned the `escapeHatchCaller` role
  is the only addresses that can call a function with this modifier

@notice The `escapeHatch()` should only be called as a last resort if a
 security issue is uncovered or something unexpected happened

@dev `Vault` is a higher level contract built off of the `Escapable`
  contract that holds funds for Campaigns and automates payments.

@dev The white list of approved addresses allowed to set up && receive
  payments from this vault

@dev The address assigned the role of `securityGuard` is the only
  addresses that can call a function with this modifier

typeDescriptions.typeString: struct FlowInsightVault.Payment storage ref[] storage ref

documentation.text:
@notice States the total number of authorized payments in this contract
 @return The number of payments ever authorized even if they were canceled

@notice Called anytime ether is sent to the contract && creates an event
 to more easily track the incoming transactions

@notice The fall back function is called whenever ether is sent to this
  contract

documentation.text:
@notice `onlyOwner` Sets the address of `securityGuard`
 @param _newSecurityGuard Address of the new security guard

devdoc.details: `Vault` is a higher level contract built off of the `Escapable`  contract that holds funds for Campaigns and automates payments.

params._marketplace: The address of the contract being authorized/unauthorized

params._amount: Amount to be paid in wei
params._paymentDelay: Number of seconds the payment is to be delayed, if  this value is below `timeLock` then the `timeLock` determines the delay

returns._0: The Payment ID number for the new authorized payment

params._idPayment: ID of the payment to be canceled.

params._newEscapeHatchCaller: The address of a trusted account or contract to  call `escapeHatch()` to send the ether in this contract to the  `escapeHatchDestination` it would be ideal that `escapeHatchCaller` cannot  move funds out of `escapeHatchDestination`

params._newOwner: The address of the new owner. 0x0 can be used to create  an unowned neutral vault, however that cannot be undone

params._idPayment: The payment ID to be executed

params._absoluteMinTimeLock: The minimum number of seconds `timelock` can  be set to, if set to 0 the `owner` can remove the `timeLock` completely
params._escapeHatchCaller: The address of a trusted account or contract to  call `escapeHatch()` to send the ether in this contract to the  `escapeHatchDestination` it would be ideal if `escapeHatchCaller` cannot move  funds out of `escapeHatchDestination`
params._escapeHatchDestination: The address of a safe location (usu a  Multisig) to send the ether held in this contract in an emergency
params._maxSecurityGuardDelay: The maximum number of seconds in total   that `securityGuard` can delay a payment so that the owner can cancel   the payment if needed
params._securityGuard: Address that will be able to delay the payments  beyond the initial timelock requirements; can be set to 0x0 to remove  the `securityGuard` functionality
params._timeLock: Initial number of seconds that payments are delayed  after they are authorized (a security precaution)

params._delay: The number of seconds to delay the payment
params._idPayment: ID of the payment to be delayed

returns._0: The number of payments ever authorized even if they were canceled

params._maxSecurityGuardDelay: The new maximum delay in seconds that  `securityGuard` can delay the payment's execution in total

params._newSecurityGuard: Address of the new security guard

params._newTimeLock: Sets the new minimum default `timeLock` in seconds;  pending payments maintain their `earliestPayTime`

allowedMarketplace.details: The white list of approved addresses allowed to set up && receive  payments from this vault

authorizeMarketplace(address,bool).notice: `onlyOwner` Adds a marketplace to the `allowedMarketplace[]` white list

cancelPayment(uint256).notice: only `allowedMarketplace[]` Cancel a payment all together

changeEscapeCaller(address).notice: Changes the address assigned to call `escapeHatch()`

changeOwner(address).notice: `owner` can step down and assign some other address to this role

collectAuthorizedPayment(uint256).notice: only `allowedMarketplace[]` The recipient of a payment calls this  function to send themselves the ether after the `earliestPayTime` has  expired

constructor.notice: The Constructor creates the Vault on the blockchain

delayPayment(uint256,uint256).notice: `onlySecurityGuard` Delays a payment for a set number of seconds

escapeHatch().notice: The `escapeHatch()` should only be called as a last resort if a security issue is uncovered or something unexpected happened

numberOfAuthorizedPayments().notice: States the total number of authorized payments in this contract

receiveEther().notice: Called anytime ether is sent to the contract && creates an event to more easily track the incoming transactions

setMaxSecurityGuardDelay(uint256).notice: `onlyOwner` Changes the maximum number of seconds `securityGuard` can delay a payment

setTimelock(uint256).notice: `onlyOwner` Changes `timeLock`; the new `timeLock` cannot be  lower than `absoluteMinTimeLock`
